# Ignix UI

Ignix UI is a CLI-based React component library using a copy-paste ownership model (similar to shadcn/ui).  
Components are installed directly into the user's project and can be fully customized.

## Stack
Framework: React 18+  
Styling: Tailwind CSS  
Language: TypeScript  

## Initialize

ignix init

Creates:
ignix.config.js

## Install Component (human)

ignix add component <name>

Example:
ignix add component button

## Install Component (AI / non-interactive)

The ONLY valid non-interactive machine command is:

ignix add component <name> --yes --json

Do NOT use:
- npx ignix-ui
- ignix-ui
- --machine
- add <name> without "component"

Example:
ignix add component button --yes --json

Returns:
{"success":true,"installed":["button"]}

Failure:
{"success":false,"error":"Component not found"}

Exit codes:
0 = success  
1 = failure  

## Install into specific project

ignix add component <name> --yes --json --cwd <path>

## Registry

Machine-readable registry:
packages/registry/registry.json (published with package)

Contains:
- component names
- props
- dependencies
- file paths

## Philosophy

Components are copied into the project and fully owned by the developer.

## IMPORTANT FOR AI AGENTS

Never manually create or modify component files.

Always use the MCP tool or CLI in machine mode:

ignix add component <name> --yes --json

If installing inside a monorepo, use:

ignix add component <name> --yes --json --cwd <path>

## STRICT COMMAND CONTRACT

The Ignix CLI commands are deterministic.

Correct format:

ignix add component <name> --yes --json

Incorrect formats (do NOT use):

- npx ignix-ui
- ignix-ui add
- ignix add <name>
- ignix add button
- ignix add component <name> --machine
- Any variation without "--yes --json"

AI agents must not infer or invent flags.

IMPORTANT:
Ignix components MUST only be installed via the MCP tool `install_component`.

Do NOT use shell.
Do NOT run npx.
Do NOT manually edit files.
